TopicTitle: How to verify my purchase id

Articles.Content: I purchased Kerbal Space Program in steam (no, not through the KSP website, through steam) and i'm wondering how to verify that I have KSP on my account.

Welcome to the forum

In your steam client, the top right corner shows your username. Click on it to open the drop down menu and choose 'Accountdetails' (or similar, I have to translate it on my own^^) which will bring up a new page in your client window. Now, on the right side, you can see 'Licences and Productkeys' (or similar) which will direct you to a list with all steam games on your account.

Also, it should be visible in your library...

Edited August 26, 2018 by 4x4cheesecake

Yes, there should be a big tab called "LIBRARY".  If you click on that, then all the games that you own should be listed in alphabetic order. The ones that you have downloaded will be white, and the ones that you've purchased but not downloaded for the first time will be gray. KSP currently takes a little over 3Gb of disk space on your system.
